summary: Email chain between U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr. discussing scheduling a lunch meeting to discuss their respective Epstein investigations. The emails show coordination between federal and state prosecutors regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York

persons.name: Cyrus Vance Jr.
persons.context: Manhattan prosecutor corresponding with U.S. Attorney Berman about scheduling a lunch meeting to discuss Epstein investigations; congratulates Berman on Epstein indictment.

connections.description: Prosecutors from different jurisdictions (federal and state) coordinating to discuss their Epstein investigations.

New York County District Attorney's Office
keyFacts: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and Manhattan DA Cyrus Vance Jr. were coordinating to discuss their respective Epstein investigations in July 2019.
Berman mentions an Epstein bail hearing scheduled for July 18, 2019, that was moved from 9:30am to 11:30am.
Vance congratulates Berman on the Epstein indictment in an earlier email dated July 7, 2019.
The emails show professional coordination between federal and state prosecutors regarding the Epstein case during the period of his 2019 arrest and prosecution.
